189050.name: Claudette Gardel
comments: She cannot teach at all!! Uses only slides and doesn explain anything clearly.POOR!
She was very excited about biology. She even got me interested.
She sucks. She talks too softly and incomprehensibly, goes too fast, and does not explain things thoroughly. If you defined what a good teacher is, she would be the exact opposite of that definition.
No Comments
she was pretty cool, in all sense of the word. not great, but definitely cool.

121212.name: L. Rafael Reif
comments: Professor L. Rafael Reif Is passionate about education. Its clases Is very interesting, She show you the worth of Hardwork at Massachussetts Institute of Technology. Is a microeengineering electrical systems genius

Was an Electives i receive a C in Its Class but he is Excelent Professor. Is very though The Class he explain extremely well but is a though grader. He has and Excelent Personality . I take the course as an Electives because im not from the School of Engineering. You have to Work very Hard but remember Engineering is The Proud of MIT.
No Comments

423126.name: Kenneth Oye
comments: His class on political economy taught me wisdom that I still use even years after graduation.
No Comments
Very disorganized, not clear exactly what he's lecturing about or why, little discussion, doesn't respond well to student input

275416.name: David Benney
comments: Hilarious and enthusiastic.
Benney's the man.
really good
A hilarious guy. He'll make you laugh really hard, but if you don't like his approach you're stuck because he's the lecturer, the textbook author and he leads all the recitations.

Benney is pretty easy, but it's really hard to manage everything if you don't have someone else explain some of the concepts to you, because he most certainly won't. But how can you turn down a math class with only 4 P-Sets and no final???
This Animal... Benney has got to be the funniest professor at MIT. And his class is really good.
he says the funniest things. his class is also the easiest of the 18.02 options. (but the book isn't always clear, nor is he...)
hilarious guy. he will say a series of very notable, funny quotes.
Benney's Multivariable Calculus class is the best MV Calc class at MIT. I'd recommend it to any incoming freshman.
DJ Benney rocks the house yo.
Awesome Professor, hillarious and clear about his topic (He wrote the book too)

1506177.name: Noam Chomsky
comments: Phenomenal
Wow I can't believe I actually found him on here. I've never taken a class with him but I appreciate all the talks he gives on Democracy now and I think his heart is in the right place after all.

When he coughed I thought he might die, so that was quite frightening. He was otherwise really inspirational, but I guess I'm biased with my preference for the elderly. If you have the chance, take this course quick (and if you want to get a good grade, bring some menthol oil, to clear his airways)
All-around great guy.

877827.name: Miyuki Hatano Cohen
comments: I took introduction to Japanese with her at BU. She is a very nice and highly energetic lady. You can truly she her passion for teaching. The only things wrong with her is the odd energy she has early in the morning and she teaches at a very fast pace.

Great teacher. A little weird and hyper at times but then don't take her at 8 AM. Office hours are a little early, but worth going to. Chapter tests can be difficult, so try to bone up on all the kanji, vocabulary, oral exams, and projects you can. No idea about how the final will be. This year. Moderate-difficult. Next year? Who knows? STUDY!
Great professor. Very fun, a little hyper, and keeps her students engaged by constantly incorporating each student into the class with questions. Superb professor and teaching style.
She's a very nice and approachable professor. She'll make you actually enjoy class. Highly recommended.
Fantastic teacher. Very enthusiastic, easy to approach. On par with Shingu sensei. You will enjoy class when she teaches because she is very kind.

141310.name: Ikue Shingu
comments: Had not consulted with the department head after starting their first academic year at NC State. Students were tested on the understanding of culture which counted between 25 and 30 percent of their test grades - never explicitly stated. Worked hard to best in this class by getting a tutor half way

Students in the class vary in fluency and comprehension. Students consistently have had trouble with the work load. The professor didn't decrease the work load. The grading of all written assignments were far more strict than all except one faculty member. through the semester.

One of the greatest teachers ever! She's really energetic and funny every class, and really cares about all of her students. Great explanations and her lessons always hone in and make the grammatical patterns very clear.
No Comments
She's definitely the nicest teacher of the three. Easiest to approach, most understanding.
Shingu Sensei is amazing. Amazing teacher, and amazing looking. ONe day we will run away together to Osaka, and get married by a Emperor Hirohito impersonater.

842574.name: Jay Scheib
comments: Professor Scheib's intro to acting was probably the best class I took at MIT.
gorgeous. I learned more in this class than I did in four years of course 6.

intro to acting was the best class I had at MIT, which is pretty embarrassing actually, since it is MIT afterall and this was an arts class, and depressing since I took it the last semester senior year. management '05...... (I heard composition class with prof scheib is also good. i heard it is a lot of work but a cool class.

784578.name: Craig Watkins
comments: The worst

UMassBoston hired him as a part-time physics teacher w/MIT students . He is terrible, a nightmare. Incredibly condescending and unclear. Has no social skills. Ask him why gravity is a negative force and he starts talking about his high blood pressure. I've worked on a 3.96 gpa for a couple years now and ended up failing his class. Students beware.
No Comments
Meanest professor ever.

121107.name: Rodney Brooks
comments: Cool guy
Unbelievably innovative!
really smart and weird
Totally self-absorbed. No interest in undergrad exeriences whatsoever.
No Comments

1823114.name: Daron Acemoglu
comments: Econ 14.32 Econometrics with this Professor is a smart choice. You learn a lot. He is one of The Biggest Names and very respected for The Economics Department. I recomend instead taking Econ 14.30 Statistical Methods in Economics take better Math 18.440 Probability and Random Variables and Math 18.443 Statistics both are more strong Courses .

Professor Daron Acemoglu is one of The most cited Economics on The world. He is a great Professor but is very challenging. If you love Statistics dont have very Big Problems to Pass. The Exams are though but If you Study and have passion for one of The most important Courses in Economics Take it with him . This course depends so much from 14.30

Econ 14.32 Econometrics is one of The Best Courses that i took at Massachussetts Institute of Technology. Professor Daron Acemoglu madres The Econometrics understandable but you need a great Foundations in Econ 14.30 Statistical Methods in Economics. The Class is interesting and is not The worst If you compare it with Econ 14.126 Game Theory.

Econ 14.32 Econometrics with The Professor Daron Acemoglu Is not The Worst Experience but he Is Better than Joshua Angrist . Is difficult to understand Its language . The explanations of The material Is confusing. Econometrics Is not Mathematical Economics Is Based more in Statistics. I Like The Course but was so difficult The Language barrier.
great teacher and academic

547286.name: Gordon Freeman
comments: I absolutely loved Dr. Freeman. He presented some fascinating ideas on theoretical physics and was a joy to talk to if you could manage to get him talking. There was this shifty looking suit always poking his head in the class which made me a bit uneasy, but it was an excellent experience regardless. Such a shame he left for some job in New Mexico.
Loved every class.

I took Dr. Freeman for advanced spatial void tessellation theory and quantum finite element analysis and I really enjoyed his lectures. It's refreshing to have a professor that is so experienced with field work. I'm considering taking his advanced crowbar manufacturing techniques lab as well, I've heard nothing but good things about that class.
Great class, but he didn't show up for the third semester for some reason. Otherwise, a great teacher and by far my favorite part of the MIT experience.
Freeman was a bit on the quiet side. Dosent talk much. Showed us his pictures from Xen and his HEV. 33

By far the greatest mind of our lifetime. This Professor is a man of few words but an incredible understanding of physics and trans-solar crustaceans. Free crowbars are passed out to everyone as well. The only gripe with him that I have is his lack of understanding of time; he never quite finishes anything.

I wish that i could learn from him but he doesn't talk much... if at all, all of his demonstrations involve the physics of crowbars, particularly on any nearby windows or vents.He gave me an A so i don't mind. I was under the impression his benefactors would have him teach the 3rd part of the course, sometime in the future, but he hasn't yet.......

Dr. Freeman's teaching style is an art. I have not heard him speak once, but as long as one keeps up his demonstrations do not need to be spoken for. His labs are an exercise in learning physics via immersion. It saddens me that has not been able to find time to start teaching his planned 300 level courses; I wish I could continue with him.
One of the best classes I have ever taken.
I really enjoyed this class! The only thing that I took issue with was the fact that some sort of nicely dressed auditor was there every day and would just come and go with no regard to the class.
He bashed a headcrab that was in the process of devouring my medulla oblongata. Highly recommended!
Completely failed to teach Standard Insertion Procedures but otherwise a great professor.

His lectures were interesting. I think he has throat cancer, because he can't talk at all now. Class is like a game of charades, it's kind of fun. His life has been kinda sad, he got a degree in theoretical physics from here and all his job used to require was pushing stuff and testing monorails. He's a natural at teaching though.

Mr. Freeman was a good professor overall, but he rarely had time for class. He only came in twice to administer the exams, and both times, some evil zombies broke in and tried to kill him. Of course, he saved us all from certain death, so I would have to give him a 5 for "helpfulness." DON'T get on his bad side. He carries around a rocket launcher.

I will agree that Gordon does make class very hard, because he NEVER talks. He only teaches by example. It was a very fun and helpful class, I really enjoyed throwing boxes and playing catch with Dog. Probably the most important thing I learned is to not shoot your buggy off a cliff with the gravity gun...or else you'll be walking a LONG way.

Gordon is a genius. He shows you how to swing your crowbar such that it will kill a head crab in one shot! He has a sexy beard / gotee. The ladies can't get enough of him. Of course the G-man very rudely interrupts the class to take him away on those "jobs" he's always doing.

1134541.name: Timothy Jamison
comments: Tim Jamison is the man. His career options were: professional racquetball, ice cream maker, or MIT professor. His tests were ridiculous, but he did a great job explaining material during office hours/lecture. He really does care about students doing well, and is willing to do just about anything to help them. A great Prof.
I thought Jamison was a pretty decent prof. His lecture handouts are basically useless, but the lectures themselves are quite good.
Prof. Jamison wrote insanely difficult exams that did not accurately represent the material covered in class. Clearly a "noob" teacher...

1134540.name: Rick L Danheiser
comments: He clearly knows his stuff, but he's very unapproachable. If a student asks a question in class he basically just brushes them off and tells them to go look it up cause he doesn't have time to cover it...and then spends the next fifteen minutes talking about the exploits of some random chemist from long ago--interesting but not very useful.
Wonderful professor who kept orgo lecture as light-hearted as possible. Even his exams had fun little anecdotes on them.
the man is a walking legend.

103718.name: David Jerison
comments: Great lecturer who gives grand overviews of different concepts and connects them beautifully. Sometimes lacking in covering the minutiae, e.g. methods, calculations, but can be made up by recitation.
Best Prof. Of Maths Ever. You will understand everything in second,like instantaneous learning. He is Very inspirational and will make you a master of maths in just a few hours
I am Independent learner from Puerto Rico I took Math 18.01 with David Jerison, he explains everything excellent. I hope to meet you in person
Best ever I met in my life.I hope to meet him in the future;he's also very inspirational.
Great Professor, he makes everything easy and clear.
great lecturer

I have been taking his MIT online courses in China for quite a bit of time already. He is the best teacher I have ever had. He has great lectures and makes everything easy to understand. He gives great examples of problems to make sure everyone understands. If you're looking for a strong basis in math, go take his courses!

I took the online course on single variable calculus and was so impressed with his teaching. All my life I've hated math but he made me fall in love with calculus, he made it appear so easy and intuitive. He is an exceptional professor.

Math 18.03 Differential Equations is a very beautiful class . The course use a lot of examples from Engineering, Physics, and other Sciences. The Professor is great , he teach you to see beyond Differential Equations. The class is the most hard math requirement for an Engineering student, but is very interesting.

Math 18.01 is the first Calculus course at Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Covers All topics in Differentiation and Integration . The Professor explains well and Calculus is hard for so much people. Great Professor

Professor David Jerison at Massachussetts Institute of Technology is not the kind of Professor that you want to take Calculus. Math 18.01 Calculus I is pretty heavy , because covers Differentiation and Integration in one semester. You have to read Simmons Book and lecture notes are more worth it that going to class.

MIT Professor David Jerison for Math 18.01 is a bad choice. He explains very confusing with silly examples and very hard problems on the exam . You learn very few , the lectures notes and the book are better than the class . My friend Stacy take this class with other Professor and She learn so much that me in Fall 2006 .
Makes everything more complicated than it should be.
good
Very good explanations and an obvious passion about Mathematics.
He is awesome

First time that i Take Math 18.03 Differential Equations was with Professor David Jerison. He explain The material but are enough simple in comparison of Its exams . You have to use The Book to understand.
His explanations aren't as clear as I expect them to be

He is a nice Proffessor very Clever but difficult to understand sometimes . Differential Equations ( Math 18.03 is difficult for much people. He Give difficult Exams , but explain a too Easy in the Class and that dont help
perfect prof for calculus helped me so much :)

858785.name: William Reyes Cubides
comments: Last two postings do not belong to MIT class system. The professor is unfortunately not teaching here any more. He was one of the best I have had!
Best prof. ever. No one I have had has ever cared the way this guy does.
One word: awesome!
Absolutely awesome! His classes are NEVER boring! He is always up-to-date with what's going on in the Spanish speaking countries and brings "fresh" activities/info to the class.

144641.name: Hartley Jr. Rogers
comments: He was my recitation 18.034 (diff equations) instructor in 1967. Rather than throwing a blizzard of theory at us, he taught us how to do the work. Novel concept! He passed in 2015 but deserves mention here I believe.
Great voice!
The class was very easy. Hartley Rogers was very entertaining. It was the last time that he taught 18.022.
"orgies of cancellation!"
funny

I had a good laugh at this class when I went. I think Hartley Rogers might be just a little past his prime. Halloween was priceless, though when he stopped mid-lecture and just said "booooooooooooooooooooo." Maybe you had to be there, but an 80 year old man whose voice goes that low is hilarious.
Hillarious classes, but you can't really learn much, and the textbook isn't very useful either.
Hartley is wonderful. Class is entertaining, so sit back and enjoy the show. Many find his class helpful for catching up on sleep, but why would one wish to miss the humor. Hartley for President '04!
"My advisor (Alonzo Church) told me I should do computers, but I didn't believe him, so I did math. Boy was I wrong. I should've done computers!" -Hartley Rogers. Old, but hilarious as hell.
Took 18.02 from him 42 years ago, was great then.
Hartley Rogers is old and slow, but he is hilarious.
No Comments
Not a very good class....didn't learn much
It's worth taking the class just to joke later about him.

622889.name: Norvin Richards
comments: He's great and I love every moment in his class.
Amazing experience to listen to him. Intelligent, caring, helpful, funny. One of the best teachers I've ever had!
Not only is he an outstanding linguist, he is a gifted teacher, in the deepest sense of this word. His lessons are a real experience. One of the best teachers I have ever had the pleasure to have.
One of the best classes I had. Unbelievably smart and witty. extremely hepful. Very amusing lectures
Best Professor Ever!!! 24.900 with norvin rocks!!! This was one of the few courses I have ever had where I looked forward to lecture!
Best professor at MIT!! Great beard!!

352233.name: Daniel G. Nocera
comments: Notes are overly terse and contain mistakes.
No Comments
GOod teacher but I've definitely heard that he's a super-sleeze on the lay-days.
No Comments

352232.name: Christopher Cummins
comments: Chem 5.03 with him is pretty hard but any Organic Chemistry course is a difficult. The exams are difficult, but is a great Lecturer.
Course is good

I took Chem 5.111 Principles of Chemical Science that have Calculus and the Chemistry concepts by Prof. Cummings are not presented very clear. He is very smart but the level of difficulty if you don't study well can be hard. If you're not Major in Chemistry take this in next semester
He was wonderful. I loved the lecture he taught 'Principles of Chemical Science' a lot, and it's very inspiring.
Mr. Cummins is very knowledgeable of what he is teaching, and he has a very crystal clear and attrative voice. Love it!
Terrible, terrible teacher. Do NOT take 5.03 from this man. The confusion and lack of learning will never stop.
Puts little effort into teaching. What is covered in lecture has little to do with what is covered on exams.

Somewhat convoluted lectures, hard to follow his train of thought. Probably too smart to teach an intro level class. WAY too much focus on WHO did what and when vs. the actual chemistry. Has a very monotonous voice. You will want a good TA to explain the more abstract concepts.
Very unclear about the subject in itself. Knowing about Nobel Prizes don't help you learn what you ought to know.
He is good at conveying the material to those who pay attention in class
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

1083753.name: Paul Schechter
comments: He's awesome
Although I failed the class, he spent so much time helping me when possible and answering my questions! He never looked down on me; he was encouraging. What a fabulous professor!
If you pay attention/come to lecture he's actually pretty clear. Is definitely obsessed with physics which makes him excited about the class. Super approachable and friendly

Jumps around points during lecture. Not very clear. My high school AP physics B teacher was better than him and I thought my high school teacher sucked. I would recommend you watch the OCW on 8.01's professor instead.
Not a very good prof... very inarticulate. But friendly, which counts for something.
what a cute little nerdy MIT prof

this prof obviously dislikes teaching since he never does any...when you go to him for help, he rolls his eyes and has you do problems without indicating what you are doing wrong. HE IS THE WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD! Totally waste of time and my parent's money. Major disappointment.

955581.name: Enectali Feliciano
comments: Enectali Figueroa Feliciano was a great teacher In physics. He looks like Marc Anthony teaching Physics. He is from Puerto Rico . He studied at Stanford University. He is an expert in Dark Matter and Astrophysics in General. He challenges you . But is not the greatest at Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

Physics at Massachusetts Institute of Technology with Professor Enectali Feliciano was a great Professor . He is an expert of Astrophysics and comes from Puerto Rico. He is an excellent lecturer the exams are a little tricky. He is at Norwestern University now.
He is a nice professor but he is also a TOUGH one.

1003625.name: Ian Hunter
comments: His lectures are a bit confusing, but cram a huge amount of signals/systems/instrumentation into your head in an impressively short amount of time.

Frankly, lectures were all over the place. Much of the class was sitting around in a circle discussing our opinions about the reading material. I use these terms lightly, because it wasn't a very scholarly discussion - lots of stories. I understand Japanese Popular Culture is in itself not super scholarly, but I was hoping for more structure.

287926.name: Stanley Kowalski
comments: Physy 8.01 at Massachusetts Institute of Technology with this hateful person is a disaster . Writes bad on blackboard. Don't teach nothing new better was high school physics. He involved so much Multivariable Calculus before you take that course. Nuclear Science and Engineering and Physics majors avoid this Professor.

At The Freshman Year at Massachussetts Institute of Technology i took Physics 8.01 with this Professor Stanley Kowalsky. The Professor is Brilliant but he dont explain well and dont help The students. Three hours are an eternity and you dont learn so Much physics because he dont care about The students .
Unable to contribute anything to my learning in this course.
doesn't explain anything, extremely rude over email, condescending to anyone with a question
bad
Fast blackboard
really boring, doesn't really teach anything just reads off the blackboards, no real reason to go to class.

Found Prof. Kowalski to be a good lecturer, but that's it. When I met with him to express some concerns I had, his eyes were closed at least half the time I was speaking. His final was insanely difficult and he laughed while looking over some students exams after they had been handed in.
Boring lectures, too many derivations, not enough focus on the conceptual

Boring lectures! Luckily, the lecture notes are good and more legible than his chalkboard pictures. Sadistic e-mails, including asking us if we enjoyed his "challenging final". Perhaps Kowalski is the Physics department's answer to getting student excited about TEAL.
His blackboards are pretty. But his personality isn't very nice.
No Comments

He sent out threatening emails to our class (no joke: THREATENING). He had no sympathy for student athletes or anything else who had to miss an exam for whatever reason. The man has negative compassion.
also, he's really really fresh and sarcastic with students.

he speeds through nine blackboards like there is no tomorrow in 50 minutes, it is impossible to listen to him and copy notes.. then he posts the boards online and they're blurry, he assigns mastering physics, problem sets, AND exams all in the same week:(
No Comments

162394.name: Eric Lander
comments: He is such a professor. He's so intelligent, yet so humble! I love Eric Lnader
He's just such a great, humble,amazing (Don't forget Extreme sense of humor). He's the best teacher I have ever met!
hard

Here's the deal - I hate biology. I've tried to enjoy it, it's just my least favorite subject. HOWEVER, Eric Lander somehow made dragging myself out of bed to go to a lecture on my least favorite subject worth it. God bless you, Professor Lander
Excellent Professor of Biology so fun. I studied NSE biology is very useful and easy

If i have The opportunity take Bio 7.012 First Semester Biology at MIT . He is The Best Professor a genius really. He Explain genetics, Microbiology, Biochemistry and other Topics like different Ecosystems all in one Class . Massachussetts Institute of Technology is The best University and Its shown by The Quality of Its Professors

Bio 7.012 is Fundamentals of Biology at Massachussetts Institute of Technology. Its lectures are amazing. If you read and Study you Pass with an A. He is The Best Professor of Biology and explain Genetics like no One can. Definitely Take you learn so much and he is very intelectual. Biology was The Best course at The First year.

Clear, exciting, inspiring, thought provoking and riveting lectures. Difficult concepts for many. The software employed is helpful for understanding the concepts. Eric introduces concepts as things to be worked out. You think along with scientific development. Genomics - emphasized.
Great course for catching up with what's been happening in molecular genetics over the 45 years since I first studied it.
The best Biology professor!
My favorite teacher so far! His ability to draw you in the world of biology, the way he teaches, his dedication are second to none!

Prof. Lander is an expert in his field and a gifted lecturer. He makes very complex material not only comprehensible but enjoyable to learn. His enthusiasm in the subject matter is contagious. Lastly, he has a terrific sense of humor.
The most inspiring. Lecturer I have ever had. A real treat to have him lecture.
He's by far the best professor I have ever studied under. I was quite skeptical about biology at first, but it's now become one of the subjects I'm most interested in, thanks to his class.
BEST of the Best
A truly exceptional professor. His lectures are thorough, enthralling and thought provoking.
MOST AMAZING PROF EVER
You'll be satisfied ... believe me ...
Eric Lander is a world renowned biologist who worked on the human genome projects. He alternates lectures with Weinberg, who is very smart but is a terrible lecturer.
He's an amazing professor. He's very engaging and obviously passionate about what he does. I'm sad that the semester is already halfway over!

774737.name: Kimberly Berkowski
comments: CHem 5.13 Organic Chemistry was a extraordinary experience with Prof. Berkowski. She is extremely excellent teacher . You must have to do the work but she explains extremely well .
BEST PROF AT THE INSTITUTE EVER
She explains things clearly and gives great reviews. very enthusiastic!
Totally unfair grader - not helpful or understandind at all
Dr Berkowski is WONDERFUL. She has the cutest "When I was in grad school..." stories :)
She is Amazing!!!
She's smokin'. And I guess she's good as a prof too.
She is down to earth and very enthusiastic.
No Comments
best class i ever took at the tute....
Lied to me. Was unfair in final course grade. I feel cheated.

1867667.name: William Minicozzi
comments: He was a good and clear lecturer, sometimes a bit fast. Makes jokes sometimes, seems like a friendly guy. It was possible to miss lecture and still get by in the class but not ideal.
Minicozzi is the best. He's hilarious and his lectures are pretty clear. 18.02 was great with him.

His lectures are hilarious. Yes the material is all posted online, but I show up to classes to listen to his sassiness :) Tests aren't incredibly difficult; they are (like he says in lecture) very similar to the practice exams posted online.

He is not the most fantastic lecturer ever, but he covered the content without too many hitches (considering it was his first time teaching the class, it was good. I'm expecting he'll get better.) He is also HILARIOUS. He has a great personality and sense of humor. If you go to office hours, he is also quite helpful there. Highly recommended!

99389.name: Michael Sipser
comments: Excelent Profesor of Mathematics and For Theory of Computation . Very nice Professor gives you chocolate for any correct answer. Also encouraging you to do your best .
amazing

Sipser is awesome!!! He gave out Snickers bars for correct answers in lecture, and did an overall awesome job of explaining multi-variable calculus. Lots of sweet quotes from him, too. Sips is the man!
A really great guy that tries to keep his classes interesting and amusing while delivering the material in a lucid and straightfoward manner.
No Comments
No Comments
Does a great job teaching a hard course

798501.name: Elena Ruehr
comments: A wonderful, caring professor.
A really superb teacher who really knows how to compose and how to impart the info to her students. One of the best I've had in my 3 years at MIT.

She knows her stuff, but always seems so ditzy when trying to impart it; not an admirable quality when instructing some of the brightest minds in the world. A composer, she tends to refer to her own work a lot; frankly I would prefer that she use "real" composers such as Mozart and Bach for reference until her influence reaches beyond Cambridge.

312515.name: Richard Shrock
comments: I'm sure he's a nice guy, but he's a horrible teacher. I (and more than half our class) stopped going to lecture because it was useless. All he cares about is his particular interests, aka the stuff he won his noble prize in

Lectures sometimes a bit disorganized, but the demos were fun, and he seems very enthusiastic about them. Willing to explain points following lecture. Significant discussion of his research interests toward the end of the course, which was interesting. Last lecture discussed how to win a Nobel prize, and he brought in a copy of his medal.

He's a genuinely nice and funny guy, but I felt like I could really follow his lectures. He means well though, and he likes to keep class lighthearted, which I appreciated. I just don't think teaching is his talent...
He's a nice guy, good demos, just his lectures are incomprehensible, and I don't even think he knows it.
shrock sucks
No Comments

667161.name: Zoltan Spakovsky
comments: Very challenging class, but an extremely knowledgeable professor

Hands down the best professor I've had here. His enthusiasm for the subject material is infectious - Thermodynamics was one of the few classes I legitimately enjoyed, because he made me want to learn. He demands a lot, but if you accept the challenge, you'll learn a lot.
Hot only because of the ponytail...

87635.name: Wolfie Ketterle
comments: Professor Wolfgang Ketterle Nobel Prize Winner in 2001 is an excellent lecturer. He makes you thing a lot on the exams . He covered all the material for the class and make an excellent use of Massachusetts Institute of Technology High End Technology
The best professor of physics super smart and enjoyable lectures
So brilliant it's fun just to watch him think :)
Amazing guy. Inspiring.
He has an accent that's hard to tell. It's not really his fault though-TEAL sucks.
ITS WOLFGANG
He knows his stuff. Really likes this stuff. Kind and helpful. :)
No Comments
No Comments
trust my ekvations...

667163.name: Mark Drela
comments: literally the best
Great Prof! Great notes, teaches clearly, fairest grading, and the most interesting part of Unified!
Great Prof! Great notes, teaches clearly, fairest grading, and the most interesting part of Unified!
Drela is the man. He's the only part of Unified that I liked.

121181.name: Steven Leeb
comments: Wasn't sure which lab to take - within 2 lectures I was sold. Absolutely the best class I've taken at MIT. I totally agree with the class description - This class is the reason you came to MIT.
Clear, organized lectures and very approachable. One of my favorite professors at MIT.
I had a lot of fun in this class! Leeb got me interested in digital electronics, which I previously did not care much for. He's always enthusiastic and definitely knows how to teach.

893325.name: Donca Steriade
comments: Linguistics courses at Massachusetts Institute of Technology are not piece of cake . She is a great Professor but is very challenging and demanding. You have to read so much . But I recommend it if you like to read . I took the course a couple of years ago .
Amazing

Yes, she teaches with a take-no-prisoners attitude, but the class (if you attended and paid attention) was fantastic and inspiring. Everything I learned was new to me. Linguistics is a science and Steriade is its God!

This was single handedly the worst class I have ever taken. Everyone said linguistics was fun but after this class I never ever want to see nor heard linguistics mentioned ever again. Please do not let any of your friends take this class.
No Comments
So boring. I was legit interested in linguistics before. Now I would rather swim in the charles than sit through another linguistics lecture.

144636.name: Haynes R. Miller
comments: Prof. Miller taught me to do elegant proofs in 18.014 Calculus with Theory. He is a great professor you learn so much but have to put efforts . He do proofs very natural and is a brilliant Mathematician . Sofía

In Spring 2007 I repeat the wonderful experience that I had in 18.014 . I took 18.024 Multivariable Calculus with Theory that is Calculus II proof emphasize. 1419469.name: Christopher Weaver
comments: Although not technically a programming class, learning Agile variants and how to apply McConnell metrics while team coding in Unity made it one of the most useful coding classes I have taken. Professor is always there for students and committed to our learning. This was an awesome class--just sorry it had to end.
Amazing class. Professor is famous but never shows it. Many other game luminaries who are his friends did guest lectures. Learned more in this one course than almost all others. Take it.
This course should be a core requirement for two terms. Loved the ride. Loved the burn. Loved the course.

Great class, but be prepared to work for every one of those twelve credits. Professor said it was a "Boot Camp". He wasn't kidding. But I would take it again because there was so much stuff that I couldn't absorb it all the first time. One of my best classes in four years. Should be required for programmers.
Simply a fantastic experience. Never worked so hard! But really loved the way the class evolved and the things we learned. Will never forget the lessons.

One of the best lecturers I have had in four years at MIT. I appreciate the environment the Professor establishes with the students where each one is individually responsible for his or her own progress. It conveys a great deal of trust in his students and simulates real world expectations. A masterful teacher and a unique classroom experience.

As a female engineering major, I cannot think of a more genuinely supportive teacher. The Prof made sure I knew the theory and then told me to take chances and understand my own power to change the team's destiny. I learned so much I want to take the class again. My top class at MIT.

A previous student recommended I take the class. The Professor said that he hoped each student would remember at least one thing from the class long after we graduated. Well, I am graduating next month and have a list of things I will remember. The class is a standout and should be a Course 6 requirement. Weaver rocks!

Came in not knowing what to expect. Came out knowing more about development techniques and thought process than any other class! Worked hard but in the end it was well worth the effort. Recommend without hesitation--so long as you are prepared to do the work.

Learned more about team development here than any other class. Professor is no nonsense. Lectures sometimes got long, but the information was there. Sometimes almost too much information to digest at one time. But it all came together toward the end. All the info tied into what we would need to complete assignments. Tough but very rewarding class.

This was hands down the best class I have taken in four years at MIT. If you get a chance, take it, do it. You will be amazed at how much the Prof. knows about every facet of the industry and how good he is at teaching his "craft". I wish I had taken it as a freshman! Learned a ton!

Will update but am enjoying the class. The Prof's stories and depth of experience are amazing. The lab is a bit daunting, but he says he won't let us crash and burn...but he is definitely one to let you explore how far you can get on your own. I am working my ass off but having a good time. This is definitely a "Master Class".

Surprisingly witty dude. Really tells it like it is. Knows his stuff on every level but really good about taking questions and giving thoughtful answers. I came away with an amazing amount of information, and some practical experience because of the lab component. You'll do a lot of work. But the guys a rock star so what do you want?

Weaver founded Bethesda Softworks. Great depth of industry and technical knowledge. Loves teaching and it shows. Makes himself available and is a wonderful mentor. One of my most memorable classes at MIT.
Knows his stuff! Excellent lectures. Have to do a lot of work but well worth it. Learned a ton.

y

From granting a last-minute extension on an exam so I could take it another day to meeting with me to discuss test taking strategy... absolutely phenomenal help to me this semester. I did really badly on quiz 1 and almost dropped the class and he really gave me the confidence to keep going.

CS is not my main area and most of the other people in class had a lot more coding experience so I was playing catch-up a lot of the time. Barton has raised the pedagogy bar to levels I never knew existed in academia. He is by far the best professor I have ever had.
You can revamp 8.05 ten more times, but I WILL STILL LOVE YOU BARTY! Super clear and organized explanations that will make you believe physics is easy (although the tests may change your mind :) )
I LOVE YOU ZWIE-BIZZLE!!!

i love barty!

1139554.name: Alan Guth
comments: Guth's 8.07 is a great class. It can be quite challenging with unexpected spikes in difficulty and workload, but he is typically quite understanding and generous with both extensions and extra credit to compensate. Definitely worthwhile
A joke this professor is, and a joke his entire theory is. I shall never dare to visit a petty lecture of his again, for I value my sanity and moral values.

I took a physics course in Astrophysics at graduate level was very interesting . He is a great lecturer and he talked about Dark Matter, Anti Matter , Dark Energy and more depth concepts in cosmological physics.
The best prof I have this semester. Despite being a nominee for a Nobel Prize in Physics, he can still clearly communicate basic concepts
Very smart. Very helpful. Very nice.

1201822.name: Elizabeth Vogel-Taylor
comments: The best professor for Principles of Chemical Sciences 5.111 at Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
Excellent for Chemistry any course with her at Massachusetts Institute of Technology easy A+ . Sofía N Smith PE

Chem 5.111 is Principles of Chemical Sciences at Massachusetts Institute of Technology. The class is very interesting. She really cares about your learning chemistry. Is a difficult course but is beautiful connected with other sciences like biology, quantum mechanics, and the chemistry of the universe. Excellent Professor
she is the best
She actually cares about students

Dr. Taylor is an incredible teacher. As an instructor, she gets to focus all of her time on teaching, and it shows in her lectures. They were all very clear and well-organized, and therefore very easy to understand. She made me really enjoy organic chemistry.
this teacher is amazing!! Search for this video on youtube to watch a lecture of hers. (15. Valence bond theory and hybridization) she's really good
she is hot, and good
She is awesome. Her style of teaching is very good and easy to understand. The quality of teaching is excellent. Thanks a lot for such a nice effort.
She is OBSESSED with vitamin B12. She also just gives us cheap methods to find the information we're expected to know for the course, but doesn't impart any understanding at ALL.
Her lectures are very easy to understand. The notes she hands out are extremely helpful for p-sets and exams.
Dr. Taylor is wonderful. Her lecture notes were organized and understandable, and she is incredibly nice.

800239.name: Gilbert Strang
comments: I really appreciate the time I study Linear Algebra. Never feel better about learning.

I watched his videos about linear algebra on YouTube because my linear algebra prof couldn't teach, and honestly, I am so thankful for this man's lectures! His videos helped me pick up my grade from a D to B in linear algebra. He is overall straight to the point, and goes slowly enough to make sure you understand the concepts.
Great professor. He picks perfect examples to teach the insight of linear algebra and matrix theory without getting too bogged down in calculations.
Fantastic dude.
Gil Strang is an absolute legend. Not much more to say.
Professor Strang is the best! He delivered his lectures with such clarity.
Very useful videos on the internet!!!

I took 18.06 Linear Algebra with Prof. Gil Strang . He focus its class on new problems, and Matrix Theory . A lot of Applications taught me to think 🤔 critically in Mathematics. He is very brilliant professor . Explains well all the Topics in Linear Algebra and Differential Equations Sofía
As an economist from 1970 i have valued and enjoyed learning all about matrifes. Thank you. A real inspiration to look for more and enjoy maths or math if you prefer.
an amazing professor
Very Good, i enjoyed his lectures for linear algebra, and they made me feel exited for it
The best professor for Linear Algebra at Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He gives a lot of applications
Really enjoyed his lectures!
This guy made me fall in love with Mathematics

FYI - he states certain prereqs are optional, but uses examples from them at times (e.g. diff eqs), I had to refer to such background. Still - a nice guy, motivational.

Math 18.06 Linear Algebra is the most difficult course that I took . The Professor Gilbert Strang is excellent. He always invented new problems. He applies linear algebra to engineering, computer science, economics and finance . This course is very useful in Economics. The book is very hard and also the exams . For me is the best Proffessor at MIT

Gilbert Strang is not prepared for his lectures. He knows his stuff but he's not prepared for transferring his knowledge and the order of the meterial he wants to lecture. That's why he usually starts a sentence and modifies it many times while speaking. I rarely see him saying a sentence in a single take. He starts a sentence, pauses, restarts ..

I took Math 18.06 Linear Algebra with Prof. Gilbert Strang he explains extremely well and include many applications. The book is more difficult to understand but you learn mathematics with him. For People that majoring in Finance and Economics this class with him is a real solid choice. Look for Gil Strang when you enrolled for 18.06 Linear Algebra
awesome

Is The Best Professor for Linear Algebra especially to Engineering, Computer Science and Economics Applications . He explained very well but The Exams are extremely difficult . He loves Linear Algebra and he dont understimate The ability of the Student to learn Mathematics. I like The course so much i majored in Economics and was truly inspiration

367160.name: Shankar Raman

508978.name: Meg Jacobs

Awful. Mean. Condescending
Avoid. Terrible class all around.
All fluff. She makes amazing # of factual mistakes, running jokes with students. Arrogant also.

She is a beautiful nice teacher who is more beautiful and nice than your average teacher.

1134538.name: Tyler Jacks
comments: Very good at lecturing, although sometimes moves very quickly. Is open to questions and good at explaining things.
Great sense of humor, extremely knowledgeable, and adorable.
Nice to have a big name professor teaching this intro class. Shame that the teaching instructor she-who-shall-not-be-named ruined the class.

936817.name: Brian Subirana
comments: Let me be very clear, this is one of the best courses in breath in Big Data - seriously. Prof. Subirana takes a wide swath of fields and brings in domain experts (6+ profs) to analyze them at the frontier. For me, this was really introductory. I've taken advanced engin. courses in the space, yet this was the most complete for application + theory
Shameful exploitation of MIT students to advance own business interest in RFID. avoiding real issues, forgiving of non-originality.
He is a nice guy but rather tardy. Do not expect him to be punctual about anything.

141360.name: Alvin Kibel
comments: He is a pretty hard grader on essays. The class was at times very boring, but sometimes he did bring up interesting discussions. He goes off on tangents a lot and will bring up some controversial issues. He seems like a very intelligent man in the subject (Art of the Probable), but it took a lot for me to keep my eyes open during his lectures.
Horrible teacher. Class was incredibly boring and he just went off randomly and never inspired actual, meaningful discussion. Worst class I've taken at MIT.

Kibel is a very hard grader so be prepared to write good papers. The subject matter is pretty interesting and despite being critical of students during discussion, Kibel is a pretty good discussion leader.

Alvin Kibel is brilliant. He brings the world of poetry alive, and he invites you to join him. He won't pave the road for you or anything, but he wants you there if you earn it. So earn it, and you'll love his class.
he's very rude in class, picks on students,makes political and religious comment

144127.name: Moungi Bawendi
comments: He gives amazing intuitions. A very good teacher overall.

This Professor is an Excellent Profesor for Thermodynamics in Chemistry . He teach you a lot and the exams are no difficult. Is a nice person and have great teach skills. I found the material of the class very interesting if you like to study .
The material is boring, but he's really good and he follows his lecture notes
Very clear lectures. He followed the standard 5.60 notes very closely.
boring class, but prof was fun
Made a boring class slightly more boring. Poor guy had nothing to work with.
Good lecture notes, terrible lecture!

702502.name: Igor Pak
comments: It's obvious that Professor Pak knows his stuff. His lectures are very useful. I didn't really have to consult the textbook while doing homework, which is very rare for a math class in my experience. Same could be said for exams. I didn't really need to do much outside studying other than reviewing the homework and lecture notes. He also has humor.
deserves tenure!
No Comments

95063.name: Albert Meyer
comments: Boring lecture videos. Gives ambiguous questions. Course could be more structured and more formal. Comes to our table, does not look at our response, starts 'lecture' on why we must come to class prepared.

The class is a flipped classroom style, so the professor doesn't really matter. He occasionally appeared while our group was working and gave vague feedback that left us more confused. Outside of the classroom, he was horribly uncooperative. He changed course policies frequently and never had a helpful response when students asked questions.
great Professor he allows his students to share and receive much needed information. Loved him

too easy.

631540.name: Junot Diaz
comments: Great
Overall good class. I would recommend
Good Class!!

Junot is one of the best teachers ever! The class has great discussions and he creates an environment in which everyone is respected and encouraged to contribute. He's hilarious and knowledgable. I learned a lot about writing and wish i could take another class with him.

Junot is wonderful. He is one of the few professors I've seen here who truly cares about his student's success. Junot is brilliant, and insists that his students create their own brilliance. His class is fun, and helpful, and a breath of fresh air from the dullness that is usually MIT.

125151.name: Arthur Mattuck
comments: I took classes with Professor Mattuck years ago. He puts great preparation into teaching classes. A wonderful and inspirational professor.

Professor Arthur Mattuck is one of the most respected professor at Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Ordinary Differential Equations deals with Euler Equation, Linear Algebra, applications in Engineering, Chemistry, Physics. The book Linear Algebra and Differential Equations is an excellent book . No math courses are piece of cake.

Math 18.03 Differential Equations at Massachusetts Institute of Technology with Professor Arthur P Mattuck is a solid choice . He covers a lot of Matherial Complex numbers , Eigenvectors, EigenValues, Partial Differential Equations. Applications to Engineering,Physics and Chemistry. Is the most difficult course for every engineer. Excellent

Math 18.03 Differential Equations with Professor Arthur P Mattuck is one of the best of Mathematics Department. The class is challenging he cover Fast Fourier series transform, Eigenvectors, Eigen Values . How ODES apply to engineering and sciences. He is so good that one friend from a mediocre UPR Mayagüez Can't pass its first OCW Exam

I took Math 18.100 Real Analysis at Massachusetts Institute of Technology. I do my bachelor in Nuclear Science and Engineering(22), Physics and Chemical Engineering I love all the Theorems and his is a genius
Best prof, hands down!

Math 18.03 Ordinary Differential Equations is one the most difficult courses that you ever faced in your Life. The Class Covers Fourier series, complex Exponentials, linear algebra topics, and a lot of Engineering applications. The Professor is very helpful and funny. The course don't include economics or finance application. exams are superb hard.

I was majored in Economics and Mathematics I took Math 18.100A Real Analysis he is an excellent Professor . The class is very though . He is very accesible and incredible person . The Exams are very though but prepares you For Math 18.701 Algebra .

Math 18100A Real Analysis is one of The most difficult Courses at Massachussetts Institute of Technology. Is Mathematical logic thinking . Prof Arthur Mattuck is an excellent Professor and Its book in Real Analysis is a must have

Math 18.02 Multivariable Calculus at Massachussetts Institute of Technology was and Extraordinay Experience. Prof. Arthur P Mattuck teach you how to think versus memorize formulas. This is The Best Professor of Mathematics at Massachussetts Institute of Technology. He Includes Partial Differential Equations and linear Algebra very useful .
Is The Best Professor for Differential Equations

Mattuck was probably the most accessible professor when I attended MIT, his door was always open and I soon found no embarrassment at asking any questions at all, moreover he offered cogent explanations in simple to understand terms. I would stop by with questions from other courses and he always obliged. I wish every professor was half as good.
Great professor. I'm 15 and currently learning his course on Differential Equations from OCW, and he's brilliant. Really explains the topics clearly and makes it easy to understand.

For math professors, he's about as good as it gets. Its refreshing how he doesnt bog the ideas down with mathematical jargon, and instead presents the main ideas in layman's terms, allowing the students to focus on the actual math.
Mummbly and rambling
absolutely BRILLIANT!
Love this guy, all the way from University of Houston!
I HAVE NEVER GONE TO MITNOR PLAN ON DOING SO BUT I MUST ADMIT HE WRITES VERY CLEAR AND HIS EXPLANATIONS ARE THOROUGH

I attended the equivalent of 18.03 at UBC in Canada and watched Dr. Mattuck on iTunes U to learn the course. He simplifies everything so clearly that I went from 40% to 100% between two midterms without going to my actual class. Give this man a medal!!!

1103018.name: Hazel Sive
comments: I learned bundles of intellect from her fave professor ever!!!
She's really enthusiastic about teaching and biology, which makes the class so much more interesting. Plus, she really cares about the students, and is just a fun person.

Wonderful professor. Kept us engaged with little quiz/prize interactions, used relevant modern examples related to concepts. Also has great blackboard technique and clear writing. Exams were long, but that's to be expected within the department.
Distracting and grumpy, but very good on the blackboard and well prepared.
AMAZING PROFESSOR! Lectures are comprehensive, with applications to modern experimental biology techniques. Made me want to switch majors.

1259688.name: Ben Brubaker
comments: Prof. Benjamín Brubaker is a great Proffesor for Math 18.01 . The Exams are though and so much homework
Wonderful lecturer!
Amusing lectures, adorable man, tough exams.

395136.name: Janet Schrenk
comments: All I want to say is that she wants people to understand the material not memorize and that's why the class is hard. If you really like chemistry and some challenge, you will like her class. If you are doing well in her class, you are above average. (she is a great professor to get to know and use her tutoring hours-she is very helpful!)

I feel sorry to take chemistry class with her. It seems that UMASS hires the worst teachers ever. The connect homework is very hard. I barely see her solving connect problems. I do not understand a lot of things. I am sad. I tried to google some connect questions, but a lot of them don't make any sense. I feel sad being in her class.

Here's the thing, Dr. Schrenk is not too bad if you show that you care about learning and are friendly with her. Academically, she certainly knows her chemistry very well, but it seems you have to know everything before taking her class to get good grades. I found her grading and quiz material unfair at times. Waaaaay too much homework!!

She told us at beginning of the semester, day 1, that if you didn't already take chem 1 or an equivalent chem course in hs, you would have to struggle to achieve 70s on her quizzes and need 80s on hw to PASS, even though she knows you need a 65 to get credit. Doesn't answer questions when she asks if people have any before quizzes. Don't take.

Worst chemistry professor I have ever had. Goes over topics in the homework that have not been covered in class. She will explain them the day after it is due. Quizzes are unforgiving and has many surprise questions from previous chapters. Lectures are terribly boring and are all worthless power points.
does not explain concepts well, doesn't go over material before quizzes although they are for the most part fair, assigns homework on material not covered yet

To me, she seemed like a good prof. if you showed interest. Does assign a lot of work and does not scale. But overall I learned a lot and if you put the time in and go to her for help. She'll do anything to help you pass. She even stayed up late emailing me helping me with the homework before the test and she is always there to help whoever asks

She's a nice person and interesting to talk to. Her Quizzes are poorly worded and are impossible to prepare for. She doesn't warn students for what to study. I recommend all students studying every form of conversion and make sure to read word for word every part of the text. Her notes in class are useless along with her lecture.
A very difficult professor who doesn't know how to teach. She's not mean but most of the class will struggle to pass. Ruined chem for me got a C after getting an A in Chem I. I'm at UML as well

Had her for chem 2 at umass lowell. Found her class extremely difficult. I may be going out on a limb by saying that her teaching plan from MIT is no different than the one here because this class is ridiculous. I spent 10 hours a week at least on the homeworks and still passed only 3-4 quizzes. Learned a lot but quizzes are way too hard. No scale.

Now she is at UMass Lowell and her homework assignments are still way too long, her test averages are still way too low, and her lectures are still terrible. She teaches as if the prerequisite for Chemistry II is Chemistry II itself...every step of the way she talks down to the class as if we were supposed to already have known everything.
stinks
Inconsiderate. Extremely inconsiderate.
Needs to take a little more time getting dressed in the morning. My saving grace in this class were my TAs. I think this class is Janets revenge against the world.
No Comments
Homework assignments are way way tooo long, she doesn't post practice test answers or grades online and is the worst lecturer. It saddens me to pay $40K a year for this.
I agree so much w/the comment about patronizing comments and tests. There is no way of guessing at this woman and she doesn't curve to a B. Yay! Let's fail half the class!

A strange paradox of teaching styles, especially for a required class. She delivers lectures as if students were in middle school, asking patronizing rhetorical questions, yet exams and homework are long, poorly worded and harshly graded. C- test averages
Hard grader (way too hard for a GIR!), doesn't seem to like teaching in new ways.
No Comments
